definition: Wang Guowei (1877-1927), noted scholar
surname Wang
king or monarch/best or strongest of its type/grand/great
to rule/to reign over
surname Guo
country/nation/state/national/CL:個|个[ge4]
abbr. for Uighur 維吾爾|维吾尔[Wei2 wu2 er3]/surname Wei
to preserve/to maintain/to hold together/dimension/vitamin (abbr. for 維生素|维生素[wei2 sheng1 su4])

sentences.english: Wang Guowei is the founder of China's modern aesthetic.
sentences.chinese: 王国维是中国现代美学的奠基者。

sentences.english: Wang Guowei is the first person to achieve modern transformation of academic research in China.
sentences.chinese: 王国维是中国学术研究实现现代转型的第一人。

sentences.english: The philosophy and aesthetics of Wang Guo-wei are deeply effected by Schopenhauer.
sentences.chinese: 王国维的哲学和美学思想深受叔本华的影响。

sentences.english: Wang Guowei is a great man of letters in modern and contemporary Chinese history in academy.
sentences.chinese: 王国维是中国近现代学术史上的巨灵。

sentences.english: WangGuowei's "natural" can be divided into two levels.
sentences.chinese: 王国维的“自然”文艺观可分为两个层次。

sentences.english: The suffering doctrine is the theory basis of life speculation of Wang Guowei.
sentences.chinese: “苦痛”说是王国维人生思辨的理论基点。

sentences.english: Dual Personality manifests itself most strikingly in Wang Guowei.
sentences.chinese: 双重人格在王国维身上有着鲜明的体现。

sentences.english: Wang Guowei occupies a unique place in the History of Chinese Aesthetics.
sentences.chinese: 王国维在中国美学史上有独特的地位。

sentences.english: Ms. Ye Jiaying has a profound elaboration of Mr. Wang Guowei's "theory of realm".
sentences.chinese: 叶嘉莹先生对王国维的境界说作了深刻的阐发。

sentences.english: It is thus note-worthy that various reasons contribute to the death of Wang Guowei.
sentences.chinese: 应该注意到，王国维的自杀是多种原因综合造成的。

sentences.english: He breaks with Peking University due to his connection with the royal family of the former Qing Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 因与清室的关系，王国维又与北京大学断交。

definition: Feng Youlan (1895-1990), distinguished Chinese philosopher
Gong Zizhen (1792-1841), Chinese man of letters, calligrapher and poet
Liu Shipei (1884-1919), Chinese anarchist and revolutionary activist
Hu Shi (1891-1962), original proponent of writing in colloquial Chinese 白話文|白话文[bai2 hua4 wen2]
Liang Qichao (1873-1929), influential journalist and a leader of the failed reform movement of 1898
Zhang Taiyan (1869-1936), scholar, journalist, revolutionary and leading intellectual around the time of the Xinhai revolution
Wang Fuzhi (1619-1692), wide-ranging scholar of the Ming-Qing transition
Yan Fu (1853-1921), influential Chinese writer and translator of Western books, esp. on social sciences
Lin Shu (1852-1924), writer and influential translator and adaptor of vast swathes of Western literature into Classical Chinese

Zhou Zuoren (1885-1967), brother of Lu Xun 魯迅|鲁迅, academic in Japanese and Greek studies, briefly imprisoned after the war as Japanese collaborator, persecuted and died of unknown causes during the Cultural Revolution
Wen Yiduo (1899-1946), poet and patriotic fighter, executed by Guomindang in Kunming
Cai Yuanpei (1868-1940), liberal educationalist, studied in Germany, president of Peking University 1917-19, minister of education for Guomindang
Lu Xun (1881-1936), one of the earliest and best-known modern Chinese writers
Wang Shizhen (1634-1711), early Qing poet
Ku Hung-ming or Gu Hongming (1857-1928), Malaysian man of letters, highly regarded for his literary works written mostly in English, and known for his monarchist views
Liang Shuming (1893-1988), modern philosopher and teacher in the neo-Confucian tradition
